website_summaries.verdict: Delivers 4,000 volt charge and is also USB rechargeable. We like the solid construction and ease of use.
pros: Includes an LED light for day and night use

customer_reviews.title: Long story short, I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Many a fly has been smitten by this mighty zapping device! No more are the days of flies freely and thoughtlessly tresspasing on the sanctity of my home. Those few that survived and got away tell tales of the mighty zapper made by Zeus himself. They tell stories of how their friends and close ones were taken out mid flight with just a woosh and then a loud zap. How their lifeless bodies were then disposed of unceremoniously in the trash... Never to be seen or their annoying buzzing be heard ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Eduard

customer_reviews.title: It seems to work great! I can't wait to it gets warmer and ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work great! I can't wait to it gets warmer and the big wasp and flys are out..I am ready for them!!! I have to find a way to hook it to my Lawn Mower? Thank You..
customer_reviews.author: Kay M

customer_reviews.title: Zaps the gnats
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the biting buffalo gnats we have this time of year. It is light weight and easy to swing. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CB Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This really works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This really works. We have been dealing with fruit flies and they have been extremely annoying. Vinegar didn’t work like they say online. So when I saw this I just had to try it out. This bug zapper is amazing. My son loves going around the house and zapping the fruit flies. You hear it when you hit one. I would definitely recommend this to everyone. I can’t say enough about it. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works great, you get a distinctive pop and gets the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, you get a distinctive pop and gets the smaller ones as well. Surprised it works much better than the last one I had with batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This really does work great!
customer_reviews.text: This really does work! And no batteries needed is a super plus and usb cord is included! Beware that it is very powerful and startling at first. LOL 😆 It is safe because you have to turn it on & hold the button for it to work. Great safe design frames out the wired mesh so that it raises it enough to keep it from touching the surface when it’s resting. Great buy. I do recommend and I would definitely buy again. I may just order 1-2 more to have in different areas.
customer_reviews.author: wrshpr655

customer_reviews.title: Thank you the items arrived in perfect condition. The only thing I want to say ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank you the items arrived in perfect condition. The only thing I want to say is i would of liked to have all three orders of large zappers . I didn’t realize I was ordering different sizes . Maybe more highlighted sizes of what your ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was just as described. Received the order very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Nilza

customer_reviews.title: It works great right on your target.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them yet, but my neighbor has the same and it works. The best thing about it as opposed to those hanging bug zappers is you can target the mosquitos and not harm any other flying insects. I live in Costa Rica where there are known 35,000 insect species and I do not want to harm other bugs. It is rechargeable to avoid costly batteries and waste.
customer_reviews.author: Lori K

customer_reviews.title: Great defense against gnats and such
customer_reviews.text: These work great against gnats, fruit flies, cabinet moths, mosquitoes...I like the usb charger instead of batteries. The usb cord sent is super short, but any android charger will work in its place. Fast charging.
customer_reviews.author: jaz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work great. They are a little smaller than the single version but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jose P.

customer_reviews.title: Good times, good tool!
customer_reviews.text: Cool product! The flashlight is decently bright and it zaps pretty well! It’s fun to chase bugs around, but nasty when the bug gets stuck and starts to barbecue. The loud taser sound is fun, too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THE RECHARGEABLE ONE. It worked great for about 6 months. Then stopped working. I just charged it and it worked for a few minutes and stopped working again. I think I'll try the one that takes batteries instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sue D.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Charging cord is included
customer_reviews.text: Was really surprised about these being rechargeable. Even has a switch if it does get bumped it wont zap you or little one. So far so good. Charging cord is included.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday. So far, WOW! This thing packs a punch! The bugs were not just zapped, but disintegrated to the point that I didn't even have to clean them out of the zapper after they were zapped. So far,,, very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ybp9003

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: Killed a few things waiting for season, but thing makes me jump about half as much as victim......really has a pop......love it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Elizalde

customer_reviews.title: Will only zap your wallet
customer_reviews.text: If I could review with no stars, I would. The only thing that worked on these was pressing HARD on the middle from both sides to get a zap. I would have returned them, but it rained at the campsite and the box got wet. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: J's Ebie

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The mosquitos were getting out of control this ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The mosquitos were getting out of control this season so the Zap It racket is a necessity. Fun to hear the "snap" each time I get one...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Boeldt

customer_reviews.title: They do "zap", but there's one rather glaring product ...
customer_reviews.text: They do "zap", but there's one rather glaring product defect: The unit can be powered on with the indicator LED lit normally (and the little "flashlight" will also light up), but if the unit has had some use since the last recharge, the "zap" function may not work at all. It's frustrating, because you have "visual indications" telling you that the "zapping" should be working, yet you directly hit a bug and...nothing. Obviously, if there's not enough battery charge to power the "zapper", it would be logical to have the indicator LED go out. I've seen that behavior on both the units that I got, and two others that a friend has.
customer_reviews.author: Jmark

customer_reviews.title: Turn it on push the button down and kill the bugs... it's as easy as 1...2...BZZZAP
customer_reviews.text: I tried a bug zapper like this before and it didn't work at all...THIS BUG ZAPPER RACKET IS GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: lovespalmz

customer_reviews.title: This one is a Mini (item description doesn't say that)
customer_reviews.text: looks like a decent item, but it's waaay smaller than the other ones we have. Only place I now see that mentioned is in the picture at the bottom... I'd recommend getting the full size one so you can kill them 'skeeters...
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Great Bug Zappers!
customer_reviews.text: Charged up in about 4 hours. Went to work killing flies. These both work! I've bought expensive zappers that didn't kill anything but my patience! A great solution to a nasty problem. No poison sprays or anything else needed. Fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Darla Ken  Pearce

customer_reviews.title: one of two works...junk
customer_reviews.text: One of two works. First time use. Seriously disgruntled. Doesn't hold a charge for more than an hour...not much good at a baseball game. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Chargeable, kills bugs on contact, fun and great for camping
customer_reviews.text: OMG !! this is honestly the best purchase I have ever made it works exactly as it should you smack that fly and the Zap it zaps the sh*t out of it, awesome that they can be charged instead of battery operated, also fun to take camping gives kids something to do just make sure the kids are being supervised while using of course and I wouldn't let anyone younger than 8 use it, this product was worth way more than I paid if you're thinking about buying this is your sign to DO IT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: TESHANIK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing better than hearing that "zap" and the flash of light when those pesky mosquitoes meet their demise! This product works great. Since there are two racquets, we even have contests on who can score the most kills. Sorry not sorry, mosquitoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things!! Best invention ever!! And it’s so entertaining!
customer_reviews.author: R3113R

customer_reviews.title: Awful battery life.
customer_reviews.text: In theory the product works. However the battery life is about a minute long. Literally. I got the 2 pack and have tried both rackets with the same results. I live in a tropical area and was hoping to be able to use this on my porch but I whack about 3 bugs before the battery is dead. Very displeased. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These are very small. Listing the actual measurements in your description would be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received them in a timely fashion. As directions indicated, I charged before use. The first one accepted charge and all light indicators worked as expected. However, when I went to charge the second zapper, no lights worked indicating that the device was being charged. Thought maybe it had a full charge and was ready to use. I will be sending back if it fails to work as reported. Disappointed in purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Nohren

customer_reviews.title: It is so much fun and works fantastic!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I always wait a long time to write a review to make sure. and because it seems like cheap plastic i was not sure until i used it. OMG, it works for everything that flies. I initially purchased for camping in my rv but ended up bringing one home. kills fast. you just cant swat a mosquito away by hand. this thing works for mosquitoes and even my tiny fruit flies at home. it is so satisfying. there is no way to kill so many bugs with so little effort with any other device i have ever tried. ive had and used for many months and still works like it is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for biting flies and mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Great product, and have purchased these in the past. Sometimes, somehow, the mosquitoes get through the electric part but overall a great and easy product for adults and children. It says it doesn't electrocute you if it touches you; however, this past weekend I did zap my leg when I wasn't thinking and zapped a mosquito that was on my leg... and then the current ran onto me! Wasn't that bad, but keep an eye if littles are using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin V.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and product!
customer_reviews.text: We had a minor issue, so I contacted the Zap It people on a Saturday. I heard back from them on the same day! The issue was resolved quickly. I was VERY impressed with their costumer service. Also, the zapper was much sturdier than the previous brand I had, and it worked great! I would highly recommend both the zapper and the company.
customer_reviews.author: JEC

customer_reviews.title: Only stuns most flies
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great idea. The problem is that it only stuns most flies. You have to figure out where they went to hit them with something else or continue electrocuting them until they die (it is pretty gruesome). I thought this would offer a quick death, but it doesn't. Pass and find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ted H.

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a couple of years ago and was blown away and amused (in a sinister way) at how well it zaps flies and mosquitoes. It actually sparks and cracks loudly when they make contact. It stopped working after about a year or two (got mangled in the move, I think). I bought a cheaper version with batteries and it was not doing ANYTHING! I repurchased this one and am enjoying evil laughs each time I hear the bank and spark. Mwahahahaha!
customer_reviews.author: Patricie Drake

customer_reviews.title: SO GOOD, Get it now.
customer_reviews.text: They work great and even the kids love killing flies with them. Makes being outside so much better. Never could get the old fly swatter to do anything. I had no idea how much we needed one of these. So happy we got 2 since we can keep 1 in 2 locations. Great charge life and safe. Had to kill on a fly on me and did not get shocked.
customer_reviews.author: FatherOf4

customer_reviews.title: This zapper works much better than the one we previously owned
customer_reviews.text: This zapper works much better than the one we previously owned. Great price for 2. We use this with flies in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sports Family

customer_reviews.title: How did we ever live without these!?
customer_reviews.text: We ended up with a mosquito problem indoors - in Las Vegas, I know! - when hubby brought home fresh flowers on a Hawaii trip. Apparently the water was filled with larvae and those little buggers found a way to infiltrate and multiply IN THE HOUSE! Pesticides aren't an option, this makes it almost fun to eliminate the pests. Wish these were a thing years ago when I lived in MN, the 'land of 10,000 lakes'. Love that they're rechargeable, rather than replacing batteries.
customer_reviews.author: c crawford

customer_reviews.title: Both rackets were broken. Bummer i wanted and need these
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I plugged in to charge the receptor was not solidified and fell to the bottom of racket so I could not charge and their for that one racket was broken and the other would take a charge it looked like but would not zap. I was so looking forward to these help when i sit on back screened in porch. Too bad. The company said they would stand behind product for lifetime but when both come in with issue's that's a problem and it got great reviews so not sure if i will order and take a chance on these again or go with a different choice since i do need them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The best zapper on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a way to kill any flying insect on contact. This zapper is kid friendly. My kids love to Zapp the flies and mosquitoes. It sizzles them when they get trapped. It is battery operated and lasts long on a full charge. It also has a light on it to see in the dark to ensure you Zapp that mosquito. This was a great investment because it comes with 2 zappers so there should always be one available to zapp those flies away!!!
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Not
customer_reviews.text: Love these. We live on a farm and flies are A huge problem every spring and fall. I also live with a daughter who as OCD and hates bugs. These give her the satisfaction of gettin rid of the pesky sky raisins the dogs love so much. They charge quickly for fast extermination reload. Plus they are very hardy, teenagers decide they would make good weapons for sibling disagreements and they still work!!! Very good product for the price, recommend to all I know.
customer_reviews.author: lmkribbs

customer_reviews.title: Stop working within a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought it based on the review comment. However, I tried myself and this stop working in less than a week. I do not know if mine became defective which sometimes happens. So if you have good experience from others go ahead and buy it. I did not have a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Still a double tap to kill
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if the flashlight is a worth while feature. The zap is definitely louder than the Black Flag version of this racquet. However, even though it's double the voltage, it doesn't mean the likely hood of getting a one hit kill increases. I still have to do a double tap to kill the common housefly. Once to knock it out of the sky, the second time to kill it on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Gifford Hwa

customer_reviews.title: My First Test Is So DEADLY To Pesky Flies.
customer_reviews.text: In very warm night with very bright portable LED light to my dark shed as large greenish tint flies. So I had decided to point my bright light really close to bug zapper. Stupid flies has really landed directly onto metal grate, I had slowly flipped little red switch on. Then I had pressed the button -then- within millitet of second. Instant loud snap with so sudden death to pesky flies. Reason I had choose the largest one -vs- smaller mallet because of it's harder for flies maneuver around larger fast swinging with fewer misses.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose to get the medium twin pack and they were perfect for our home. We had a crazy fruit fly situation going on for a time and other racket zappers wouldn't catch them (they had larger gaps). Decided to give these a try and absolutely WORTH IT. They work on everything we need to zap and love that they recharge!! I'm tempted to buy more to gift to the family. I'm sure they'll think its a gag gift at first, but these guys have been super useful during the summers.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P

customer_reviews.title: Defective usb cable and these also look different than my previous one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace one I purchased last year that recently got damaged in my suitcase during a flight. These look much different than my original one as you can see in the pictures. Not sure if these are counterfeit or if it’s just a design change. Also, when I first plugged these into the charger I would not get a red light on either set. I thought the unit was defective and was going to return it but decided to try another USB cable before I did. The red charging light came on when I used another cable which means the provided charging cable was defective. Minus 2 stars for the defective cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't worry about the battery
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was looking for gardening. I had to fight a lot of mosquitos in my back yard while I was taking care of my plants. With this zapper, I get almost no mosquito bite. I always use this in my garden. The good thing is you can recharge it as many as you want, though I haven't tested how many times it could be charged.
customer_reviews.author: Teayoun, KIM

customer_reviews.title: These work great.
customer_reviews.text: Every now and then we get a wasp or two in the house. A couple of zaps from this and they are done..the bodies start smoking..killed a big grasshopper yesterday with no problem..Like the part about being able to recharge them and no batteries to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Oh what fun it is!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Northern New England = deer fly and black fly territory, especially in June. We are nature-lovers - to a point - a 'breaking point'. We had to do more than just keep applying bug repellent to ourselves. (not good) So, we ordered and tried these. Oh what fun!!! We still need a light application of bug repellent but revenge is sweet. Love it when it sounds like pop corn popping when swatting at a swarm of black flies trying to get at our necks, arms, and legs. A good purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: bkind

customer_reviews.title: Broke after1 month and company does not respond, i.e LIFETIME GUARANTEE", false claim
customer_reviews.text: I loved it initially, but after using for ~1month, just would not recharge or work. Tried gettimng in touch with the company, since they boast 'LIFETIME GUARANTEE", but despite 2 attempts, they never responded. So, I tried to return it to AMAZON, but they wouldn't take it back because kit had been 40 days since purchase, 10 days beond the return window. Product too expensive for such a poorly made and short-life span.
customer_reviews.author: Froggy

customer_reviews.title: Best swatter ever!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Best investment ever! This is so easy to use and it really works. I live in the desert, but I’m still not free from flies. They get in the house and drive me crazy. The fly swatter just don’t cut it. So, if you want to solve the fly problem quickly, then get this! It’s lightweight and safe. Cons: The instructions on the box are not very detailed and neither is the website. I almost returned it because I had no idea how to use it. But, the seller reached out and showed me what to. Now, those pesky flies are no longer a problem. Overall, a great buy and I will purchase more for family as well.
customer_reviews.author: SmartFire

customer_reviews.title: Works Great For Most Things
customer_reviews.text: Works on most flies. I'd recommend a tighter electrical screen for newer models, though, because gnats and noseeums fly right through without getting hit. They're just too small. I'd recommend the opposite for the outer safety screen, because larger flies tend to bounce off it, without being hit by the electrical screen. Regardless, this thing works! It's also a lot of fun. I've even found my aim, technique, and coordination improving. lol Also, their lifetime guarantee is no joke. One, unfortunately, stopped functioning properly. I contacted them and they were prompt with sending a replacement. What I didn't expect was receiving another two pack. So now I have three of these bad boys destroying the enemy army.
customer_reviews.author: Broliath

customer_reviews.title: Good but does not work on tiny flying bugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for tiny gnats that swarm my back patio during the spring and summer. This Year, 2020 has been extremely bad. but unfortunately the gnats are too fast and fly above and away as soon as I start swinging this particular tennis racket sized electrocuter. I think it would work OK for flies if they are standing still, but I don’t have a fly problem. So have not had the chance to try it on them. Overall I think this product will work well if you have slow moving insects but mine just fly away and come back the next day. So unfortunately I am going to return before the 30 day policy.
customer_reviews.author: Triphopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works  but one stopped working  quickly
customer_reviews.text: Used them first day they arrived. One of the rackets stopped making electricity after 10 minutes of use. The working one does kill bugs great of you can hit them with it. I just felt like the other racket was destined to stop working also and returned them both. Not sure if i would try another set or not.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! My dogs are terrified of regular fly waters, they are not so afraid of these because all the noise they make is a little zzitt sound when a bug hits them. They are very easy to use the button you push to activate it is in the perfect spot, right under my thumb, and I love that they are rechargeable. The yellow jacket did not die right away, but it was stunned enough for me to finish the job!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scary malfunctioning unit
customer_reviews.text: Update: one of the swatters is now “shorting” out by simply touching the button. No bugs around, nothing caught in the wires, just scary pops, flashes and buzzes (see video attached). I’m afraid to use it. It HAS held its original charge, so that’s a plus... Quick charging, frighteningly powerful - bugs literally explode and vaporize - kinda scary, but at least it’s quick.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt N. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Safe, effective, satisfying.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Although not designed for yellow jackets, it effectively eliminated an over aggressive one at an outdoor venue with a satisfying “pop.” It is very effective at taking out flies, Gnat’s and mosquitoes as well. Easy to use, charges quickly and comes in a two pack, so when one is charging the other can be employed. I wasn’t sure these would be very effective, my doubts however were removed. This is a great product and fun for anyone who wants some payback on pesky flies, blood sucking mosquitoes, or biting gnats. As a warning - you may smell burning as some times the bugs turn into little fireballs.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Small zappers.
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida where every bug on earth either wants to fly in your eyeballs or eat you. Love bug season came and we had hundreds swarming around the house. I definitely thought these were the monster horse fly killing machine zappers I had when I was younger but these are way smaller. I attempted to zap and started to smell the sweet scent of success. I stopped and turns out, it was still alive! Some were electrocuted but others just got even angrier. I didn’t realize the size which is probably why they are cheaper than other options. I do however like the safe option of to turn it on and then hold the button to zap.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron and Samantha Burns

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use these in the summertime, the hardest part is knowing when to swing, kind of like swinging a tennis racket at a tennis ball, except a fly’s trajectory is much less predictable. These Bug Zappers are battery powered and can be charged through the USB port located at the end of the handle. Bug Zapper has a lifetime warranty, just send the defective Zapper back to the company and wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MODsquad

customer_reviews.title: Works but could be better
customer_reviews.text: So, the item works as described. However the quality ad build feels very cheap. The one issue I have with this is the functionality. There is a main power switch which needs to be turned ON in order to operate the LED light which is built in, problem is the power switch also activates the 3000 volts mesh, so there is no way just to use the LED light without activating the mesh. Lastly the LED light built in is a joke! It cannot illuminate even a couple of feet ahead of you. Totally useless feature and more of a marketing gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh

customer_reviews.title: ZAP!  Great for killing smaller insects
customer_reviews.text: I love these rackets. I keep one inside for any bugs that may get into the house, and one in our sun room since flies like to sneak in with the dogs. They work pretty fantastically, but if I could, I'd deduct half a star because they typically don't kill flies on contact. Flies (and larger bodied bugs) get stunned on the first zap, and require a longer contact to kill. All in all it's effective because while they're stunned you can get a follow up final blow. Smaller bugs get fried instantly. I'd definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Far, far, far, far exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Fly population is an issue in my farm shop. Took two Zap-It units, hooked them up to a USB wall charger, taped the activate button so they were on continuously, then laid each on a shallow plastic pan containing water and fly magnet fly attractant. Over a four hour period each Zap-It unit killed well over 100 flies (while the fly magnet bottle captured only 15-20). Few flies remained after the test period. Watching and hearing the nasty flies die was a real rush. BLM will probably riot because the flies were black.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CHARGING CABLE DIDN'T WORK AND COMPANY NON-RESPONSIVE
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, but absolutely NO response from the company about the charging cable not working. Got the smaller Zap-its and that cable works fine, but want to keep them in different locations. Wonder how good their warranty is if you can't even get an answer about a non-working charging cable. Contacted them TWICE. My fault in part for not opening the package after ordering during the winter until past the 30 days for Amazon to help me. Just know that the lifetime warranty doesn't appear to hold much weight.
customer_reviews.author: Cagey

customer_reviews.title: PROS N CONS
customer_reviews.text: Likes: powerful (the fly disintegrated poof! into thin air)large surface area, no need to swat like with a regular swatter u just have to graze the fly🤣, it has a light! it can be recharged, it has a safety so it doesn’t engage unless u r pressing the side button. Dislikes: heavy, no where to hook it or hang it, having to press the button for it to actually electrocute the fly... (even tho its a safety mechanism it would be easier to just turn it on n have it work u will know not to touch it) LIKES OUTWEIGH THE DISLIKES! SO WORTH THE MONEY SPENT! I HATE FLIES N IT GIVES ME JOY TO HAVE THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: arleene zavala

customer_reviews.title: Ugh, used?
customer_reviews.text: Photos provided. First impression upon opening the box: - scratches and signs of being used was noticeable, I even used a macro lense to check - rust on the USB cord provided, a small thing however, I still paid for a new one - it's portable enough even for camping and lightweight - you do have to aim a bit more accurate since it is the mini version I am aware that there's a lot of returned products in Amazon but this was too obvious. I will be updating my review once I use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Amaborn

customer_reviews.title: Cleaner than a fly swatter.
customer_reviews.text: Every summer for about two full months the black flies are all over the place. I have used the larger size from a different company and did not like it. This mini zapper is great. I have one on the patio and one in the kitchen. Using the Old fly swatter I would have to go around kill all the flies then come back around to clean all the dead innards off the counter, now zap they fall to the ground dead. I carry one in the yard since I am allergic to bee stings and have panic attacks when I hear anything buzzing near me.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grams

customer_reviews.title: Zap small flying insects easily
customer_reviews.text: This is the only way to kill mosquitoes and small moths that fly around but don’t land. I find it less effective for flies because they are sometimes a little too big for the grid. I like that it is rechargeable. It is also the only zapper that hasn’t stopped working within a year. I went through three other brands that operated on batteries and they all quit in less than a year. I put in new batteries but they were just broken. I have had this zapper for at least three years and it is still going strong. This new purchase is for my daughter, who had a different brand, battery-operated, that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Wondertwins

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not big or powerful enough. It takes a while for the long-legged mosquitoes to die. It takes about four or five zaps or continuous charge for about six seconds before they die. I feel like I’m torturing them. These zappers can’t handle getting dropped at all, and it was only about four inches. The first one broke because I tapped it against the door when I tried to zap a flying bug. Just tapped. They worked for a little while and they do eventually kill the bugs, but I don’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful punch in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of different bug zappers and so far these have been the best. Our problem is gnats. Those tiny Lil buggers are hard to zap. Other zappers we've tried are flimsy or the charging ports would not hold charging cord well which led to zappers that weren't charged. Other problems we have had is zapper not holding a charge well. A zapper isn't much good if it always plugged in charging. These are much smaller in size than other swatter zappers, but are far more effective(and you get 2). These are practically blowing the gnats apart. What a satisfying feeling to hear the zaaapppity-zap-zap.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 of the 2 worked
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for about a week, and started to notice that one of them does not turn on properly with the power button pressed, even when fully charged. I would have to press real hard on the "ON" button, and the power indicator would turn on, but intermittently. Sometimes it turns on for a second to several seconds and other times it doesn't respond at all. The other item still works, but I am returning both rackets since there is no option to just return 1 piece from the set of 2.
customer_reviews.author: Sam I am

customer_reviews.title: Cool to use
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool to use! Not sure if it would completely replace a regular fly swatter because it still takes work to catch them. I knocked off 1 star because sometimes it doesn’t kill the flies and it just tazes them and they are still alive and it makes me sad because I am torturing them. For those strong flies, you have to zap them 3 times before they die. I do wish it was a little thinner because it’s hard to get into the window area where the flies hide at the bottom (where all the dirt is). The sound still scares me every time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This purchase was not for me
customer_reviews.text: The product works, but I never was fast enough to kill anything with it. It takes a while to get the hang of it. For the price, I would not recommend. When trying to kill insects, you have to strike them in the air. It doesn't work to try and kill them while they are stationary. Also, we have several wasps in our area. They will not die with one swat. You have to keep swatting three or four times.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: Works for small gnats, flies, mosquitoes, and spiders
customer_reviews.text: This has been great. We have used for even the small grass gnats as well as other flies. It is great heating the sound as you get a whole bunch at once. My wife has become a terminator. We keep one in back yard and one on front porch. I was able to get mosquito one night, we dont have many here. Nice benefit is that we are a le to use on nuisance spiders also, the ones that create webs where you walk. There are some of.the bigger flies that are harder to get,like they know what it is and take off. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Product Longevity
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Unfortunately, both my rackets stopped working in about 2.5 months (I purchased in July 2020 and it's September 2020). My understanding is if you have a warranty on them you can claim replacements. I did go through the process of getting the warranty and just made a claim prior to writing this review to have them replaced. I will update this review if the claim process does not work and will also update my review to 1 star. I bought a Zap-It racket that wasn't rechargeable years ago from Home Depot, and it lasted a couple of years before I needed a replacement. I'm not sure the rechargeable product is as durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Swing low, sweet...
customer_reviews.text: I love these mini zappers that are much easier to handle than their larger counterparts. The double pack is a good deal. I use one for my car, and the other as a replacement for magazines in the restroom.
customer_reviews.author: Gospel Jon

customer_reviews.title: You need these!!
customer_reviews.text: These zappers are pure gold!! For whatever reason, we have been inundated with many types of wasps and hornets where I live and every so often, a rouge wasp or hornet gets into the house. This works!! One swat and bye-bye!! There is nothing more satisfying than hearing that snap and crack of the zapper. I carry it with me when I go outside too -- I'm allergic to bee stings and you can't be too careful. The charge lasts a good long time too. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah BoughterTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Small ones are perfect! Work great!
customer_reviews.text: We just moved to the country and have had a lot of moths, mosquitos, gnats, etc. from doors being open while moving stuff into the house. We went with the little rackets because the large seemed like they would be huge and awkward. The small ones are the perfect size and work really well! We discovered some gaps in the window screens that are being fixed, which explains why we had more little flying insects getting in than we would have expected. These make it super easy to take care of them quickly!
customer_reviews.author: AZMAW

customer_reviews.title: WHAT! WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! This is one of the best things I bought off of Amazon. It was perfect for what it was meant for right out of the box, as soon as I took it out, a moth flew by and I half-heartedly swang at it, didn't think it was going to do anything because of some reviews I read but to my amazement.. 💥BANG💥 it literally disintegrated 🤯 We get a lot of moths here at night and I hate it however last night I was looking for them because this sh*t is fun!!!😏🦟💥😆
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and the company stand behind their guarantee. Many of this mosquito zappers are of extremely poor construction. Especially, the activate button on many brands/models is very flimsy but people often press that button fairly firmly because of the excitement of trying to get the mosquito before it has a chance to escape. No such problem here. Also, I have bought a few of these and the one time I did have a problem the company did respond with prompt, friendly, courteous service.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Stockdale

customer_reviews.title: erases mosquitoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: So awesome! I was having trouble enjoying my gardening as clouds of mosquitoes were stalking me. I armored up in denim and then strode into a cloud of these suckers (sic) and just started swatting them. It was like erasing them from the sky! One moment there is an agent of evil hanging there, the next there is a zap and a smell of something burnt to a crisp. Get the big one so you don't have to aim. VERY HAPPY!!!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Joe the Prof

customer_reviews.title: SHOCKINGLY DISAPPOINTED! Not anymore!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all. Charged it fully and it doesn’t shock anything. Here I was thinking I was going to be sending flies and mosquitoes down the green mile but nope. Don’t buy this. Save your money and use a magazine or your hand to kill them suckas. Update: yeah umm, zapped the hell out of me and THEN it started zapping every bug known to man. I was outside at 9:30pm looking for more mosquitoes to zap just because. So yeah, great buy. Just needs a jump start I guess.
customer_reviews.author: rigoberto Flores

customer_reviews.title: Forget the movies this is entertainment at its finest!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Zappy tennis rackets!!! It's been super wet and hot outside and hundreds of mosquitos over took our house! Today we went to war. It was not only satisfying hearing the zaps but also extremely fun! Although my dog doesn't agree.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All Purpose Zapper
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not only effective, but a ton of fun. We get a lot of mud wasps looking for mud in our lawn, and the Zapper does a great job on them. As for flies and mosquitoes, if you are fast enough, you can kill a bunch of them. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ganssle

customer_reviews.title: Charging light does not work
customer_reviews.text: right out of the box brand new the product is flawed so cannot give it more than 3 stars light that shows when and if the charge is happening is burnt out. Hoping the rest of the stuff on it works. How hard would it be to know a bright led light is working or not before you put it in the box at the factory on second thought I am going to lower that to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Marc

customer_reviews.title: Snap crackle pop
customer_reviews.text: The thing zaps and zaps hard. Lots of satisfying snaps. The downside is there are switches and lights and several times I had a mosquito in my site and swung only to find that the switch was off. I realize this is a safety feature, but the part of reason these things are so enjoyable is because they are a little dangerous, in my opinion. They also destroy house flies. Oh, and because two came together, I can double wield. Score!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cunha

customer_reviews.title: wellbalanced, rechargable, and fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the price was great for 2 Zappers, I can now keep one in the kitchen and 1 in the LR. It's an effective fly killer most of the time, sometimes the bug needs more than 1 jolt to kill it, the other zappers I've had performed about the same. The accessories on this are cool, a flashlight, rechargeable via USB, and balanced lightweight racquet, just make this the best choice out there!
customer_reviews.author: Erri

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few different electric fly swatters and like the ability to recharge these. Mine didn't have instructions but pretty self explanatory. Have a flashlight switch on the front of handle and on/off switch on thumb side just below button to have current run through net. We've had a abnormal amount of flies this year and buddy this has already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Updated* Didn’t work at all but they sent new ones*
customer_reviews.text: Update- The company read my review and sent me two new ones to make up for my first lousy purchase. So GREAT customer service to make up for a dicey purchase. I’ll bump their stars up for great customer service and correcting a problem so quickly. Original post- Light your money on fire or buy these. Same thing. You get nothing. Both arrived defective and not working. Read instructions and tried charging etc. Missed my return window because they were a gift for my mother.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: and directions easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and appears to be in pristine shape. USB cord is included, and directions easy to understand. I've not used it yet since we have few flying insects yet (Philly Pa), but my son said they have the same brand at his work place, though it doesn't have the built in LED light for "night swatting: , and he gave the product a good review. I particularly like the safety feature that you can't get shocked, unless you squeeze or pinch the grid together. Some brands warn against touching the grid even after turning it off (retained charge), so I'm relieved that your product is much safer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work properly
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work. Amazon only lets me upload one video. But even in this one I have pressed the button and held it next to the fly. It zapped once but didn’t kill it. I had to keep shaking it for it to work. The fly was shocked several times before it finally died. This device just tortures them. PS: it’s not my house, excuse the work in progress on the wall socket! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Zunaira

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with the Zap It, especially that it comes with two. These work perfect on Mosquitoes. Holds charge for a very long time. Easy to charge. I had to use on of my own wall jacks with the mini USB connector from an old phone, so I could charge on my outside deck. They just give you a USB to mini USB cable. But functionally it works amazing. So satisfying to zap mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: erik

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it even works
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this thing only works if you catch the bugs in the air or if it just doesn't work at all. I've tried killing 2 separate bugs last night and this morning, both had landed on surfaces (ceiling and curtains). I couldn't even tell if the device was hitting the bug or not...both just dropped to the ground. No sound was made, which makes me think it didn't work since every fly zapper I've ever seen makes a pop sound when activated by a bug. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Kills Bugs Fast
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to kill Japanese Beetles which are devouring my beautiful roses. I've tried everything under the sun to get rid of them but nothing has worked. So far, this is working nicely. I've also killed a few other bugs as well. It's lightweight and easy to use although I think the battery operated one is more user-friendly. These need charged and the charge doesn't seem to last very long. Otherwise, it is doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: pssg09

customer_reviews.title: Definitely kills flying bugs
customer_reviews.text: We live next to a pond and have all sorts of creepy crawlies and the ones that fly. This does zap and kill them on impact. You will hear a pop and see a flash of light, almost like those little fire crackers you would throw on the ground and they pop around the Fourth of July. We have pond gnats which are a nuisance, this definitely helps clear them out of the way. Used it on a housefly and had to zap it twice though because of the size of the fly. The first time it immobilized the fly and/or injured it... so I had to swat it again and it was dead. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Orlantha Hoes

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Product I Bought This Year
customer_reviews.text: One of the pair I got from Amazon was DOA so I returned them. Then, I got another one from a different seller. It worked for a few weeks and helped me kill a dozen flies, but now, it is dead. I suspect that the cheap Chinese made electrical components they use inside do not withstand too many zaps. This is by far the worst Chinese made junk I bought this year.
customer_reviews.author: E. M.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to catch a fly.
customer_reviews.text: The paddle’s face area is a little small. The protective safety grid over the electrical screen can make contact with the killing screen more difficult. I did kill a ground hornet disturbing my dinner but catching a fly is difficult. The air disturbance caused by the protective grating adds to air movement when you swing the paddle maybe giving flys an advanced warning.
customer_reviews.author: Craig johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This really sucks,, worked two days and after that,, will not hold charge...
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but the mini version is a bit to small
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am a fan of any product kill mosquito. I did a larger version of the zapper (another brand) and it works pretty well. That is why I ordered this "twin pack" while it was on sale. I know it is the mini version, but the size is actually smaller than I expected. So, unless you are really sharp and accurate with your hit to mosquito, I will suggest you go with the larger version.
customer_reviews.author: LY

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't kill even smallish flies
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking this would kill flies. Great zap, great sound, but the flies all live and you have to find them stunned on the floor. Watched one recover and take back off. These are NOT large flies....small to medium. Not a fan of having to turn on and then hold a button to make it work, but understand. But....it doesn't. kill. flies.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: TINY
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these in person I was shocked. They’re barely bigger than a .99 cent fly swatted at Walmart. You can’t smack a stationary fly on a hard surface without breaking it. And have you ever tried taking out a moving fly with a fly swatted? It’s not easy. I expected this thing to be the size of a small tennis racket, or even a badminton racket, but it’s only the size of my open hand. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Richard mok

customer_reviews.title: Great for a camper
customer_reviews.text: Our campground has very small flies that you can't help but get in your camper. I use this around the main area lights after dark to zap them all before we go to bed. Being rechargeable is a great feature. Recommend for this use!
customer_reviews.author: Ranov

product_meta.title: ZAP IT! Bug Zapper Twin-Pack Rechargeable Mosquito, Fly Killer and Bug Zapper Racket - 4,000 Volt - USB Charging, Super-Bright LED Light to Zap in The Dark - Safe to Touch
feature_bullets: Powerful Pest Control: Featuring a 4,000-volt grid, our electric zapper is a modern take on traditional swatters. Instantly eliminating mosquitos, flies and other pests in a single swing, it provides peace of mind and reliable results.

Zap Day or Night: Whether you’re camping, hiking or enjoying a family picnic, our portable design allows you to zap anytime, anywhere. Featuring a super-bright built-in LED, you can even use it at night for 24-hour protection.

USB Charging: For quick, convenient charging, plug your racket into any USB device with the included cable. As powerful as it is efficient, the built-in Lithium battery offers up to 10,000 zaps on a single charge.

Safety First: With an activation button and glowing indicator light, there’s no need to worry about accidental zapping. There’s even a triple-layer safety mesh, offering extra protection when the racket is electrified.

Easy to Use: Thanks to an ergonomic, lightweight design, our racket provides comfort and control. The large frame makes it easy to target pests, and cleanup is as effortless as shaking or brushing dead bugs off the net.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,048 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
